treatment.description: Stems 60–125 cm. Leaf blades linear, 15–45 cm × 5–15 mm. Rhipidia fewer than 10-flowered. Tepals white; outer suberect, flushed greenish or brownish abaxially, lanceolate, less than 10 mm; inner spreading, obovate, 12–18 mm; pedicel 6–12 mm. Capsules round to oblong, ca. 1 mm wide. Seeds ca. 25.
treatment.discussion: Libertia formosa is cultivated as an ornamental and is an uncommon naturalized escape in California.
